page.title: 14LEISURE ACTIVITIES
page.content: Didcot Leisure Centre is to be opened officially in September 1985. It has been built near St. Birinus, the Secondary School for boys, which will be just one of the organisations to benefit from it. It contains four squash courts, a gymnasium, rock- climbing facilities, a main hall for table tennis etc. and a weight-training room. There is a balcony, a lounge and a bar. There is a lift for disabled people, toilets and changing rooms. The gymnasium can be used for cricket, netball, basketball, volleyball and many other sports. It took about 18 months to build the Centre. It is hoped that schools, sports associations and the general public will take advantage of the Leisure Centre. Many residents have indicated that an indoor swimming pool should be next on the list of priorities for the area.
